rename.from: [Web] There is no obvious improvement when xnnpack turns on multithreading
rename.to: [XNNPACK] There is no obvious improvement when xnnpack turns on multithreading

body:
The data format of the model is NCHW, but xnnpack prefers NHWC, it seems there are many transpose ops in profiling file.
Despite transpose ops, the conv op itself is not accelerate as desired([2.3x in tflite](https://blog.tensorflow.org/2020/07/accelerating-tensorflow-lite-xnnpack-integration.html)), it seems only 10% compare to wasm version. 

I noticed that ort team added supports to NHWC ops, does it mean ort tend to support both formats?
Hope some advices can be given on how to use xnnpack provider ^^ @skottmckay

Hi, 
If you don't mind, could you try to build ORT from source with this [branch](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/tree/jicwen/refactor_eps) and try again?

Here is the explanation,
XNNPACK used a separate threadpool, and `intra_op_num_threads` in the provider-options would be taking effect.
The branch I mentioned is trying to build a bridge between them, xnnpack's threadpool can share the intra_thread_num though, it frees you from offering another 'thread-settings'.

As for `kOrtSessionOptionsConfigAllowIntraOpSpinning`, I would suggest turning off it by sessionOptions. Otherwise, the two threadpool inside will content and affect eathother.

Back to the xnnpack in web, it seems we need to add provider_options support.

Hi @fs-eire Could you please help to take a look on how to turn on multi-threading?

> > As for `kOrtSessionOptionsConfigAllowIntraOpSpinning`, I would suggest turning off it by sessionOptions. Otherwise, the two threadpool inside will content and affect eathother.
> 
> when multi-thread enabled in wasm, ort will turn off session thread poll, and use global thread poll instead, so the options set in session option will not work.
> 
> ```c++
> #if defined(__EMSCRIPTEN_PTHREADS__)
>   RETURN_NULLPTR_IF_ERROR(DisablePerSessionThreads, session_options);
> #else
>   // must disable thread pool when WebAssembly multi-threads support is disabled.
>   RETURN_NULLPTR_IF_ERROR(SetIntraOpNumThreads, session_options, 1);
>   RETURN_NULLPTR_IF_ERROR(SetSessionExecutionMode, session_options, ORT_SEQUENTIAL);
> #endif
> ```

yes. for ort-web, the global threadpool is used and the per-session threadpool is always disabled. i am curious about whether xnnpack threadpool is created and initialized correctly in wasm.
Just discussd with @fs-eire, there is not a easy way to support muti-threading for XNNPACK EP currently. we will support it in the next step and keep here up-to-date of the latest progress.

> for ort-web, the global threadpool is used and the per-session threadpool is always disabled

could you give more detail about this, why force using global threadpool in ort-web?

> > for ort-web, the global threadpool is used and the per-session threadpool is always disabled
> 
> could you give more detail about this, why force using global threadpool in ort-web?

By default, the CPU threadpool is created when the InferenceSession initialize a model. When we work on the first version of ort-web we tested the webassembly threadpool and found it not working correctly - the reason was because the threadpool is not yet ready when we try to use it, and the solution is to initialize the threadpool earlier - so we create a global threadpool when initialize the OrtEnv.

> the solution is to initialize the threadpool earlier

does it mean ort-web should reuse global threadpool in xnnpack too or create xnn threadpoll when initialize the OrtEnv?

> we will support it in the next step

is there a schedule or a plan about this, maybe we can paticipate in fixing this issue if you have more important features to develop

the ort-web team will discuss about this. I consider "enabling multi-threading xnnpack EP on web" a whole task, which may include several technical items including this one.

your help is definitely welcome and appreciated. the basic idea is:
1. in `onnxruntime/core/providers/xnnpack/xnnpack_execution_provider.cc`:
     - use `#if defined(__EMSCRIPTEN_PTHREADS__)` (this macro is only defined when building multi-thread webassembly) to guard code for per-EP threadpool. For multi-thread webassembly, change the code to use a global threadpool; for other build config we keep the existing behavior
     - extract calling to `pthreadpool_create()` to a global or static member function
3. in `onnxruntime/wasm/api.cc`, function `OrtInit()` implementation:
     - add API call to `SetGlobalSpinControl()` ( the equivalent of `kOrtSessionOptionsConfigAllowIntraOpSpinning` applying to global thread pool
     - call the exposed function above to create a threadpool for xnnpack. should only do this when multi-threading + xnnpack EP is specified.

> the ort-web team will discuss about this. I consider "enabling multi-threading xnnpack EP on web" a whole task, which may include several technical items including this one.
> 
> your help is definitely welcome and appreciated. the basic idea is:
> 
> 1. in `onnxruntime/core/providers/xnnpack/xnnpack_execution_provider.cc`:
>    
>    * use `#if defined(__EMSCRIPTEN_PTHREADS__)` (this macro is only defined when building multi-thread webassembly) to guard code for per-EP threadpool. For multi-thread webassembly, change the code to use a global threadpool; for other build config we keep the existing behavior
>    * extract calling to `pthreadpool_create()` to a global or static member function
> 2. in `onnxruntime/wasm/api.cc`, function `OrtInit()` implementation:
>    
>    * add API call to `SetGlobalSpinControl()` ( the equivalent of `kOrtSessionOptionsConfigAllowIntraOpSpinning` applying to global thread pool
>    * call the exposed function above to create a threadpool for xnnpack. should only do this when multi-threading + xnnpack EP is specified.

Awesome, get it !
By the way, how could we determine xnnpack multithread works well already, are there any any positive or negtive signs?

> the ort-web team will discuss about this. I consider "enabling multi-threading xnnpack EP on web" a whole task, which may include several technical items including this one.
> 
> your help is definitely welcome and appreciated. the basic idea is:
> 
> 1. in `onnxruntime/core/providers/xnnpack/xnnpack_execution_provider.cc`:
>    
>    * use `#if defined(__EMSCRIPTEN_PTHREADS__)` (this macro is only defined when building multi-thread webassembly) to guard code for per-EP threadpool. For multi-thread webassembly, change the code to use a global threadpool; for other build config we keep the existing behavior
>    * extract calling to `pthreadpool_create()` to a global or static member function
> 2. in `onnxruntime/wasm/api.cc`, function `OrtInit()` implementation:
>    
>    * add API call to `SetGlobalSpinControl()` ( the equivalent of `kOrtSessionOptionsConfigAllowIntraOpSpinning` applying to global thread pool
>    * call the exposed function above to create a threadpool for xnnpack. should only do this when multi-threading + xnnpack EP is specified.

We try to create a global thread pool for xnnpack in api.cc and pass it to xnnpack_execution_provider.cc through session_options.

When we call `pthreadpool_create()` in api.cc, the thread pool creation fails and returns nullptr.

It seems that calling `pthreadpool_create()` in xnnpack_execution_provider.cc will still return nullptr
did you use `--enable_wasm_threads` flag in your build command line?

> 

Yes, we can be sure that we used the `--enable_wasm_threads` flag，and we can observe that the number in the global thread pool is not one
